page.title: 15BIOGRAPHY
page.content: {GEORGE McNeill-world record holder of {110 metre sprint is a former pupil of {St Martins RCPS TRANENT.}When he left school he had no real interest in running but turned instead to football.He played for Hibs, an Edinburgh team and it was these few years as a professional footballer that cost him his amateur status and the chance to run for his country in the olympics.His speed on the field was soon noticed.His first race was the Powderhall sprint held every year on the first of January in Edinburgh. A newcomer to the scene he started with a handicap but by the time the final came he raced from scratch. He once raced 100m against a race horse and won.He races in Austrailia as well as in Britain.Success has not changed George,he said on T.V. recently 'once a TRANENT man always a TRANENT man!'
